subject: Re: [junit] code coverage while testing
msgSnippet: ... Ah, you missed my point: I have no project on which to work, except for a very small project that came out of the current work on my book. Since I have
messageBody:
V R wrote:
> --- "J. B. Rainsberger" wrote:
> > Well, for my purposes, code coverage isn't /so/
> > important. I would only
> > use it, at this point, as integrated with Maven.
>
> I advocate a certain style of development (and perhaps
> a tool to go with it). [...]

Ah, you missed my point: I have no project on which to work, except for
a very small "project" that came out of the current work on my book.
Since I have no real project to work on, code coverage isn't important
to me right now, so I could easily drop EMMA into Maven (I manage my
small "project" with Maven), I have no use for it /right now/.

I would never say that code coverage isn't important. I practise TDD,
after all.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
